title: Why Votes Shouldn't Matter
body:
When this forum eventually takes over and GD goes away, the GD community will come over here. Said GD community decided to upvote [this thread](http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=4697884). You might notice that said thread includes homophobic slurs and offensive lesbian stereotypes, and it is still highly upvoted.

I do not want these people to decide what I should and shouldn't see in a forum. I also kinda want them to be banned, but GD's mods are apparently asleep today.

replies.body:
Thread was deleted.

/thread

c wat i did ther ;)
I did! Glad to see they deleted that thread.
Some of me wonders if this post was part of the reason that post was deleted - just because moderation is much better here, in large part because the mods have better tools to do their job here.
Better tools? What's the difference between forums and boards from a mod's perspective because as a user's perspective, i hate this new board layout.

I'm not really sure how the mod tools are different; I'm just passing on what I've seen Rioters say on that topic.
---
What do you hate about the layout? So far the team has been *really* receptive to feedback (basically all of the changes between the Community Beta and Boards were things that the community suggested). So if there are specific things that bother you, or that you'd like to see added or changed, *please make a post with them!*
